content.raw:
I had the following error when trying to launch a new CloudSim machine, using cloudsim-1.2.0 (private details removed from command line):

    $ ./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py <address> <key> <secret-key> <zone>
    ./cloudsim-1.2.0/inside/cgi-bin
    ./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers
    ./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py", line 51, in <module>
        machine = cloudsim.cloudsim_bootstrap(username, tmp_fname.name)
      File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 446, in cloudsim_bootstrap
      File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 249, in launch
launch_utils.launch.LaunchException: timeout while waiting for EC2 machine(s) cloudsim_c6b04475a

It looks like, from the AWS Console, that the machine was created, but never received any tags or other provisioning.

I tried the same command again, about 30 minutes later (after trying to debug the failed launch), and it succeeded.

Perhaps a timeout should be adjusted.
content.html:
I had the following error when trying to launch a new CloudSim machine, using cloudsim-1.2.0 (private details removed from command line):

$ ./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py <address> <key> <secret-key> <zone>
./cloudsim-1.2.0/inside/cgi-bin
./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers
./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/bin/create_cloudsim.py", line 51, in <module>
    machine = cloudsim.cloudsim_bootstrap(username, tmp_fname.name)
  File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 446, in cloudsim_bootstrap
  File "./cloudsim-1.2.0/cloudsimd/launchers/cloudsim.py", line 249, in launch

launch_utils.launch.LaunchException: timeout while waiting for EC2 machine(s) cloudsim_c6b04475a

It looks like, from the AWS Console, that the machine was created, but never received any tags or other provisioning.

I tried the same command again, about 30 minutes later (after trying to debug the failed launch), and it succeeded.

Perhaps a timeout should be adjusted.
